justification_for_forming_verse_range: This verse stands alone as an introduction to the character of Nicodemus, making it a distinct point in the narrative without direct dependence on the preceding text.

related_verses.text: The teachers of the law and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat.
Nicodemus, who had gone to Jesus earlier and who was one of their own number, asked,
The Pharisee stood by himself and prayed: 'God, I thank you that I am not like other people—robbers, evildoers, adulterers—or even like this tax collector.'
But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, who was honored by all the people, stood up in the Sanhedrin.
He was accompanied by Nicodemus, the man who earlier had visited Jesus at night.

translation_notes: This verse introduces Nicodemus as a prominent figure from the Pharisees, emphasizing his role and status as a ruler among the Jews. The translation aims to retain the significance of his background.

fresh_translation.text: There was a man named Nicodemus, a Pharisee and a ruler of the Jews.

source: Ἦν δὲ ἄνθρωπος ἐκ τῶν Φαρισαίων, Νικόδημος ὄνομα αὐτῷ, ἄρχων τῶν Ἰουδαίων.

related_verses.text: Nathanael declared, "Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the king of Israel."
After Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea, during the time of King Herod, Magi from the east came to Jerusalem.
The people were amazed at his teaching, because he taught them as one who had authority, not as the teachers of the law.
They were all filled with awe and praised God. "A great prophet has appeared among us," they said. "God has come to help his people."
The Jews there were amazed and asked, "How did this man get such learning without having been taught?"

translation_notes: This verse depicts Nicodemus approaching Jesus at night and acknowledging Jesus' divine authority as a teacher sent from God. It highlights the miraculous signs that validate Jesus’ ministry. The terms 'Rabbi' and 'signs' are important in illustrating respect and acknowledgment of Jesus' power.

fresh_translation.text: He came to Jesus at night and said, "Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher who has come from God. No one could perform the signs you are doing if God were not with him."

source: οὗτος ἦλθε πρὸς αὐτὸν νυκτὸς καὶ εἶπεν αὐτῷ· ῥαββί, οἴδαμεν ὅτι ἀπὸ Θεοῦ ἐλήλυθας διδάσκαλος· οὐδεὶς γὰρ ταῦτα τὰ σημεῖα δύναται ποιεῖν ἃ σὺ ποιεῖς, ἐὰν μὴ ᾖ ὁ Θεὸς μετ᾽ αὐτοῦ.

related_verses.text: But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to his great mercy, he has caused us to be born again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.
Do not marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’
And if children, then heirs—heirs of God and fellow heirs with Christ, provided we suffer with him in order that we may also be glorified with him.
For neither circumcision counts for anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creation.

translation_notes: In this verse, Jesus is emphasizing the necessity of being 'born again' or 'born from above' to see the Kingdom of God. The term 'born again' signifies a spiritual rebirth that is crucial for understanding and entering into God's kingdom.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus answered him, "Truly, truly, I say to you, unless someone is born again, he cannot see the Kingdom of God."

source: ἀπεκρίθη Ἰησοῦς καὶ εἶπεν αὐτῷ· ἀμὴν ἀμὴν λέγω σοι, ἐὰν μή τις γεννηθῇ ἄνωθεν, οὐ δύναται ἰδεῖν τὴν βασιλείαν τοῦ Θεοῦ.

related_verses.text: Who were born, not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of man, but of God.
You, however, are not in the flesh but in the Spirit, if in fact the Spirit of God dwells in you. Anyone who does not have the Spirit of Christ does not belong to him.
Since you have been born again, not of perishable seed but of imperishable, through the living and abiding word of God.
My little children, for whom I am again in the anguish of childbirth until Christ is formed in you!
That which is born of the flesh is flesh, and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

translation_notes: In this translation, the essence of Nicodemus's confusion about being 'born again' as an adult is maintained. It reflects the struggle to comprehend spiritual rebirth using physical language.

fresh_translation.text: Nicodemus said to Him, "How can a person be born when they are old? Can they enter their mother's womb a second time and be born?"

source: λέγει πρὸς αὐτὸν ὁ Νικόδημος· πῶς δύναται ἄνθρωπος γεννηθῆναι γέρων ὤν; μὴ δύναται εἰς τὴν κοιλίαν τῆς μητρὸς αὐτοῦ δεύτερον εἰσελθεῖν καὶ γεννηθῆναι;

related_verses.text: Which were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.
Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God, which liveth and abideth for ever.
Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;
That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

translation_notes: In this translation, the focus is on the necessity of spiritual rebirth through water and the Spirit for entering the Kingdom of God. The terms 'water' and 'Spirit' are emphasized as essential elements in this process of new birth, indicating the transformative experience required for salvation.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus answered, "Truly, truly, I say to you, unless one is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God."

source: ἀπεκρίθη Ἰησοῦς· ἀμὴν ἀμὴν λέγω σοι, ἐὰν μή τις γεννηθῇ ἐξ ὕδατος καὶ Πνεύματος, οὐ δύναται εἰσελθεῖν εἰς τὴν βασιλείαν τοῦ Θεοῦ.

related_verses.text: who were born, not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of man, but of God.
For to set the mind on the flesh is death, but to set the mind on the Spirit is life and peace.
For the desires of the flesh are against the Spirit, and the desires of the Spirit are against the flesh, for these are opposed to each other, to keep you from doing the things you want to do.
I tell you this, brothers: flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.
Since you have been born again, not of perishable seed but of imperishable, through the living and abiding word of God.

translation_notes: This verse distinguishes between two kinds of birth: physical birth ('born of flesh') and spiritual birth ('born of the Spirit'). The translation aims to keep the core meaning while using clear, accessible language.

fresh_translation.text: That which is born from the flesh is just flesh, and that which is born from the Spirit is spirit.

source: τὸ γεγεννημένον ἐκ τῆς σαρκὸς σάρξ ἐστι, καὶ τὸ γεγεννημένον ἐκ τοῦ Πνεύματος πνεῦμά ἐστι.

related_verses.text: Children born not of natural descent, nor of human decision or a husband’s will, but born of God.
You, however, are not in the realm of the flesh but are in the realm of the Spirit, if indeed the Spirit of God lives in you.
For you have been born again, not of perishable seed, but of imperishable, through the living and enduring word of God.
Yet to all who did receive him, to those who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God.
At that time the son born according to the flesh persecuted the son born by the power of the Spirit. It is the same now.

translation_notes: The phrase 'born again' or 'born from above' captures the essence of spiritual rebirth that Jesus emphasizes in this conversation with Nicodemus. This teaching indicates the necessity of a transformation that originates from God rather than human effort.

fresh_translation.text: Do not be surprised that I told you, 'You must be born again from above.'

source: μὴ θαυμάσῃς ὅτι εἶπόν σοι, δεῖ ὑμᾶς γεννηθῆναι ἄνωθεν.

related_verses.text: Jesus answered, "Very truly I tell you, no one can enter the kingdom of God unless they are born of water and the Spirit."
Flesh gives birth to flesh, but the Spirit gives birth to spirit.
For those who are led by the Spirit of God are the children of God.
God is spirit, and his worshipers must worship in the Spirit and in truth.
Since we live by the Spirit, let us keep in step with the Spirit.

translation_notes: This verse highlights the mysterious nature of the Spirit's work, drawing a parallel between the unseen movement of the wind and the spiritual rebirth experienced by believers. The essence of being 'born of the Spirit' is presented as a profound transformation that, while visible in its effects, remains elusive in its origins and destination.

fresh_translation.text: The wind blows wherever it wants. You hear its sound, but you can't tell where it comes from or where it goes. This is how it is with everyone born of the Spirit.

source: τὸ πνεῦμα ὅπου θέλει πνεῖ, καὶ τὴν φωνὴν αὐτοῦ ἀκούεις, ἀλλ᾽ οὐκ οἶδας πόθεν ἔρχεται καὶ ποῦ ὑπάγει· οὕτως ἐστὶ πᾶς ὁ γεγεννημένος ἐκ τοῦ Πνεύματος.

related_verses.text: Jesus looked at them and said, "With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible."
Jesus looked at them and said, "With man it is impossible, but not with God. For all things are possible with God."
But he said, "What is impossible with man is possible with God."
When many of his disciples heard it, they said, "This is a hard saying; who can listen to it?"
Oh, the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable are his judgments and how inscrutable his ways!

translation_notes: In this verse, Nicodemus expresses confusion or disbelief regarding the profound spiritual truths that Jesus is explaining about being born of the Spirit. His rhetorical question emphasizes the difficulty of grasping these concepts with human understanding.

fresh_translation.text: Nicodemus answered and said to Him, "How can these things be?"

source: ἀπεκρίθη Νικόδημος καὶ εἶπεν αὐτῷ· πῶς δύναται ταῦτα γενέσθαι;

related_verses.text: This man came to Jesus by night and said to Him, "Rabbi, we know that You are a teacher come from God; for no one can do these signs that You do unless God is with him."
And do not be called teachers; for One is your Teacher, the Christ, and you are all brethren.
My brethren, let not many of you become teachers, knowing that we shall receive a stricter judgment.
And God has appointed these in the church: first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, administrations, varieties of tongues.
And He Himself gave some to be apostles, some prophets, some evangelists, and some pastors and teachers.

translation_notes: In this verse, Jesus is addressing Nicodemus's misunderstanding despite his status as a teacher of Israel. The tone indicates a gentle admonishment, emphasizing that knowledge of spiritual truths is not merely academic but also deeply relational and experiential.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus answered and said to him, "You are the teacher of Israel, and you do not know these things?"

source: ἀπεκρίθη Ἰησοῦς καὶ εἶπεν αὐτῷ· σὺ εἶ ὁ διδάσκαλος τοῦ Ἰσραὴλ καὶ ταῦτα οὐ γινώσκεις;

related_verses.text: And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.
If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.
Whoever believes in the Son of God has the testimony in himself; whoever does not believe God has made him a liar, because he has not believed in the testimony that God has borne concerning his Son.
Therefore they could not believe. For again Isaiah said,
Therefore I send you prophets and wise men and scribes, some of whom you will kill and crucify, and some you will flog in your synagogues and persecute from town to town.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes the importance of testimony and understanding truth, echoing themes found in other parts of the Gospel. The repetition of 'we' highlights the collective knowledge of the witnesses.

fresh_translation.text: Truly, truly, I say to you, we speak about what we know, and we testify about what we have seen; yet you do not accept our testimony.

source: ἀμὴν ἀμὴν λέγω σοι ὅτι ὃ οἴδαμεν λαλοῦμεν καὶ ὃ ἑωράκαμεν μαρτυροῦμεν, καὶ τὴν μαρτυρίαν ἡμῶν οὐ λαμβάνετε.

related_verses.text: Therefore, holy brothers, who share in the heavenly calling, fix your thoughts on Jesus, whom we acknowledge as our apostle and high priest.
But he said to them, "You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world."
Set your minds on things that are above, not on things that are on earth.
So we do not focus on what is seen, but on what is unseen. For what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal.
For I have come down from heaven, not to do my own will but the will of him who sent me.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes the challenge of believing in heavenly truths when one struggles with understanding earthly ones. The translation captures the contrast between earthly and heavenly matters.

fresh_translation.text: If I told you about earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you about heavenly things?

source: εἰ τὰ ἐπίγεια εἶπον ὑμῖν καὶ οὐ πιστεύετε, πῶς ἐὰν εἴπω ὑμῖν τὰ ἐπουράνια πιστεύσετε;

related_verses.text: No one has ever seen God, but the one and only Son, who is himself God and is in closest relationship with the Father, has made him known.
For I have come down from heaven not to do my will but to do the will of him who sent me.
And now, Father, glorify me in your presence with the glory I had with you before the world began.
Men of Galilee, they said, why do you stand here looking into the sky? This same Jesus, who has been taken from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you have seen him go into heaven.
Now the main point of what we are saying is this: We do have such a high priest, who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in heaven.

translation_notes: The verse emphasizes the unique position of Jesus as the Son of Man, highlighting his heavenly origin and authority. It is significant that no one has ascended to heaven except for Him, which stresses the divine authority and unique revelation that He brings to humanity.

fresh_translation.text: And no one has gone up to heaven except the one who came down from heaven, the Son of Man who is in heaven.

source: καὶ οὐδεὶς ἀναβέβηκεν εἰς τὸν οὐρανὸν εἰ μὴ ὁ ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ καταβάς, ὁ υἱὸς τοῦ ἀνθρώπου ὁ ὢν ἐν τῷ οὐρανῷ.

related_verses.text: So Moses made a bronze serpent and set it on a pole; and if a serpent bit anyone, he would look at the bronze serpent and live.
And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.
For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ shall all be made alive.
For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
Therefore God has highly exalted him and bestowed on him the name that is above every name.

translation_notes: In this verse, Jesus references an event from the Old Testament (Numbers 21:9) where Moses lifted up a serpent to heal the Israelites. This is a foreshadowing of Jesus being lifted up (crucified) for the salvation of humanity.

fresh_translation.text: And just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so must the Son of Man be lifted up.

source: καὶ καθὼς Μωϋσῆς ὕψωσε τὸν ὄφιν ἐν τῇ ἐρήμῳ, οὕτως ὑψωθῆναι δεῖ τὸν υἱὸν τοῦ ἀνθρώπου,

related_verses.text: For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
And this is the testimony: God has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
For my Father's will is that everyone who looks to the Son and believes in him shall have eternal life, and I will raise them up at the last day.
Jesus said to her, 'I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live, even though they die; and whoever lives by believing in me will never die. Do you believe this?'

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith in Jesus for obtaining eternal life. The phrase 'believing in him' indicates a trust in Jesus's redemptive power.

fresh_translation.text: So that everyone who believes in him may not be lost, but may have eternal life.

source: ἵνα πᾶς ὁ πιστεύων εἰς αὐτὸν μὴ ἀπόληται, ἀλλ᾽ ἔχῃ ζωὴν αἰώνιον.

related_verses.text: But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
This is how God showed his love among us: He sent his one and only Son into the world that we might live through him.
Yet to all who did receive him, to those who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God.
Jesus answered, "I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me."
They replied, "Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved—you and your household."

translation_notes: This translation aims to preserve the meaning and context of the original Greek text while using accessible language. It reflects the theological significance of God's love and the promise of eternal life through belief in Jesus.

fresh_translation.text: For God loved the world so much that He gave His one and only Son, so that everyone who believes in Him will not perish but have everlasting life.

source: οὕτω γὰρ ἠγάπησεν ὁ Θεὸς τὸν κόσμον, ὥστε τὸν υἱὸν αὐτοῦ τὸν μονογενῆ ἔδωκεν, ἵνα πᾶς ὁ πιστεύων εἰς αὐτὸν μὴ ἀπόληται, ἀλλ᾽ ἔχῃ ζωὴν αἰώνιον.

related_verses.text: If anyone hears my words and does not keep them, I do not judge that person. For I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.
For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.
Here is a trustworthy saying that deserves full acceptance: Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners—of whom I am the worst.
But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
The Lord is not slow in keeping his promise, as some understand slowness. Instead he is patient with you, not wanting anyone to perish, but everyone to come to repentance.

translation_notes: This translation focuses on the intent of God sending His Son, emphasizing salvation rather than judgment. The phrase 'not to judge' is contrasted with 'to save', which reflects God's loving intention for humanity.

fresh_translation.text: For God did not send His Son into the world to judge the world, but to save the world through Him.

source: οὐ γὰρ ἀπέστειλεν ὁ Θεὸς τὸν υἱὸν αὐτοῦ εἰς τὸν κόσμον ἵνα κρίνῃ τὸν κόσμον, ἀλλ᾽ ἵνα σωθῇ ὁ κόσμος δι᾽ αὐτοῦ.

related_verses.text: For God so loved the world that He gave His one and only Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish but have eternal life.
Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised Him from the dead, you will be saved.
They replied, 'Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved—you and your household.'
Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.

translation_notes: The verse contrasts the fate of those who believe in Jesus with those who do not. It emphasizes the importance of belief for salvation and the judgment that comes from unbelief.

fresh_translation.text: Whoever believes in Him is not judged; but whoever does not believe is already judged because they have not believed in the name of God's one and only Son.

source: ὁ πιστεύων εἰς αὐτὸν οὐ κρίνεται, ὁ δὲ μὴ πιστεύων ἤδη κέκριται, ὅτι μὴ πεπίστευκεν εἰς τὸ ὄνομα τοῦ μονογενοῦς υἱοῦ τοῦ Θεοῦ.

related_verses.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden.
I have come into the world as a light, so that no one who believes in me should stay in darkness.
For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light.
This is the message we have heard from him and declare to you: God is light; in him there is no darkness at all.

translation_notes: This translation aims to capture the contrast between light and darkness while staying faithful to the original Greek. The use of 'love' and 'darkness' is preserved to reflect the moral implications of the actions of the people described.

fresh_translation.text: And this is the judgment: that light has come into the world, but people loved the darkness more than the light because their deeds were evil.

source: αὕτη δέ ἐστιν ἡ κρίσις, ὅτι τὸ φῶς ἐλήλυθεν εἰς τὸν κόσμον, καὶ ἠγάπησαν οἱ ἄνθρωποι μᾶλλον τὸ σκότος ἢ τὸ φῶς· ἦν γὰρ πονηρὰ αὐτῶν τὰ ἔργα.

related_verses.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
But everything exposed by the light becomes visible, for it is light that makes everything visible.
When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, 'I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.'
If we claim to have fellowship with him and yet walk in the darkness, we lie and do not live out the truth.
The night is nearly over; the day is almost here. So let us put aside the deeds of darkness and put on the armor of light.

translation_notes: This verse speaks to the behavior of those who engage in evil actions and their aversion to the truth that light represents. In this translation, the term 'light' symbolizes truth and righteousness, while 'darkness' symbolizes evil and wrongdoing. The emphasis is placed on the choice individuals make between the light and darkness.

fresh_translation.text: For everyone who does evil hates the light and will not come to the light, so that their deeds will not be exposed.

source: πᾶς γὰρ ὁ φαῦλα πράσσων μισεῖ τὸ φῶς καὶ οὐκ ἔρχεται πρὸς τὸ φῶς, ἵνα μὴ ἐλεγχθῇ τὰ ἔργα αὐτοῦ·

related_verses.text: You are the light of the world. A city on a hill cannot be hidden.
When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, 'I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.'
But everything exposed by the light becomes visible—and everything that is illuminated becomes a light.
But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, purifies us from all sin.
So that you may become blameless and pure, children of God without fault in a warped and crooked generation, then you will shine among them like stars in the sky.

translation_notes: In this verse, the concepts of truth and light are key. The idea of 'coming to the light' symbolizes a person's desire to live truthfully, showing their good actions which are aligned with God’s work.

fresh_translation.text: But whoever lives by the truth comes into the light, so that it may be seen clearly that what they have done has been done in God.

source: ὁ δὲ ποιῶν τὴν ἀλήθειαν ἔρχεται πρὸς τὸ φῶς, ἵνα φανερωθῇ αὐτοῦ τὰ ἔργα, ὅτι ἐν Θεῷ ἐστιν εἰργασμένα.

related_verses.text: Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him. Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
(although in fact it was not Jesus who baptized, but his disciples).
Peter replied, 'Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.'
We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.

translation_notes: The original Greek text presents a straightforward narrative of Jesus' activities in Judea. Key terms include 'baptize,' which has significant theological implications, particularly in the context of repentance and the coming kingdom. The word 'disciples' denotes those closely following Jesus and learning from Him.

fresh_translation.text: After this, Jesus and his disciples went into the Judean countryside, where he spent time with them and baptized.

source: Μετὰ ταῦτα ἦλθεν ὁ Ἰησοῦς καὶ οἱ μαθηταὶ αὐτοῦ εἰς τὴν Ἰουδαίαν γῆν, καὶ ἐκεῖ διέτριβε μετ᾽ αὐτῶν καὶ ἐβάπτιζεν.

related_verses.text: Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him. Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about three thousand were added to their number that day.
As they traveled along the road, they came to some water, and the eunuch said, 'Look! Here is water. What can stand in the way of my being baptized?'
We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.

translation_notes: This verse indicates the location of John's baptizing and the abundance of water available, emphasizing the activity of baptism as a significant event in his ministry.

fresh_translation.text: John was also baptizing in Aenon, near Salim, because there was much water there, and people were coming and being baptized.

source: ἦν δὲ καὶ Ἰωάννης βαπτίζων ἐν Αἰνὼν ἐγγὺς τοῦ Σαλείμ, ὅτι ὕδατα πολλὰ ἦν ἐκεῖ, καὶ παρεγίνοντο καὶ ἐβαπτίζοντο·

related_verses.text: For Herod had seized John and bound him in prison.
Herod added this to them all: he locked up John in prison.
For Herod had sent and seized John and put him in prison.
I myself did not know him, but he who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘He on whom you see the Spirit descend and remain, this is he who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
And they came to John and said to him, 'Rabbi, he who was with you across the Jordan, to whom you bore witness—look, he is baptizing, and all are going to him.'

translation_notes: This verse indicates that at this point in time, John the Baptist had not yet been imprisoned. The Greek phrase 'οὔπω γὰρ ἦν βεβλημένος' directly translates to 'for he had not yet been thrown into prison.' It emphasizes the timeline of events leading up to John's imprisonment, which is critical in understanding the context of John's ministry and the movement towards Jesus.

fresh_translation.text: For John had not yet been put in prison.

source: οὔπω γὰρ ἦν βεβλημένος εἰς τὴν φυλακὴν ὁ Ἰωάννης.

related_verses.text: Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.
And he made no distinction between us and them, having cleansed their hearts by faith.
After this, Jesus and his disciples went out into the Judean countryside, where he baptized.
They are only a matter of food and drink and various ceremonial washings—external regulations applying until the time of the new order.
(The Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they give their hands a ceremonial washing, holding to the tradition of the elders.)

translation_notes: The verse discusses a debate among John's disciples concerning purification practices, which were significant in Jewish culture at the time.

fresh_translation.text: Then a discussion arose between some of John's disciples and a Jew about purification.

source: Ἐγένετο οὖν ζήτησις ἐκ τῶν μαθητῶν Ἰωάννου μετὰ Ἰουδαίου περὶ καθαρισμοῦ.

related_verses.text: The next day John was there again with two of his disciples.
People went out to him from Jerusalem and all Judea and the whole region of the Jordan.
And this was his message: "After me comes the one more powerful than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and untie."
Now Jesus learned that the Pharisees had heard that he was gaining and baptizing more disciples than John—
All the people—even the tax collectors—when they heard Jesus' words, acknowledged that God's way was right, because they had been baptized by John.

translation_notes: This verse reflects the growing popularity of Jesus compared to John the Baptist. The mention of baptism highlights a significant aspect of John’s ministry and the transition of followers to Jesus, showing the shift in attention from John to Jesus as the Messiah.

fresh_translation.text: They came to John and said to him, 'Rabbi, the man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan, the one you testified about, look, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him.'

source: καὶ ἦλθον πρὸς τὸν Ἰωάννην καὶ εἶπον αὐτῷ· ῥαββί, ὃς ἦν μετὰ σοῦ πέραν τοῦ Ἰορδάνου, ᾧ σὺ μεμαρτύρηκας, ἴδε οὗτος βαπτίζει καὶ πάντες ἔρχονται πρὸς αὐτόν.

related_verses.text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights.
For who makes you different from anyone else? What do you have that you did not receive?
Unless the Lord builds the house, the builders labor in vain.
For by the grace given me I say to every one of you: Do not think of yourself more highly than you ought.
But to each one of us grace has been given as Christ apportioned it.

translation_notes: The original Greek text emphasizes that no one can receive anything unless it is given from heaven. This points to the sovereignty of God in providing all things necessary for life and ministry. In this context, John is addressing the concerns of his disciples about Jesus’ growing popularity.

fresh_translation.text: John answered, 'A person cannot receive anything unless it has been given to him from heaven.'

source: ἀπεκρίθη Ἰωάννης καὶ εἶπεν· οὐ δύναται ἄνθρωπος λαμβάνειν οὐδέν, ἐὰν μὴ ᾖ δεδομένον αὐτῷ ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ.

related_verses.text: He confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, 'I am not the Christ.'
This is he of whom it is written: 'Behold, I send My messenger before Your face, who will prepare Your way before You.'
For I say to you, among those born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist; but he who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.
There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
And as John was finishing his course, he said, 'Who do you think I am? I am not He. But behold, there comes One after me, the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to loose.'

translation_notes: In this translation, I've ensured to convey John's humble acknowledgment of his role as a forerunner to Christ rather than being the Christ Himself. The terms used in the original text emphasize the sent nature of John's mission and his testimony about Jesus.

fresh_translation.text: You yourselves can tell me that I said, 'I am not the Christ, but I am the one who was sent before Him.'

source: αὐτοὶ ὑμεῖς μοι μαρτυρεῖτε ὅτι εἶπον· οὐκ εἰμὶ ἐγὼ ὁ Χριστός, ἀλλ᾽ ὅτι ἀπεσταλμένος εἰμὶ ἔμπροσθεν ἐκείνου.

related_verses.text: Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went to meet the bridegroom.
The master of the banquet tasted the water that had been turned into wine. He did not realize where it had come from, though the servants who had drawn the water knew.
Jesus answered, 'How can the guests of the bridegroom mourn while he is with them? The time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them; then they will fast.'
Let us rejoice and be glad and give him glory! For the wedding of the Lamb has come, and his bride has made herself ready.
My beloved spoke and said to me, 'Arise, my darling, my beautiful one, come with me.'

translation_notes: In this verse, John the Baptist refers to Jesus as the bridegroom, emphasizing the relationship between Him and His followers. The imagery of a wedding is significant in Jewish culture, representing joy and celebration. The friend's joy comes from hearing the bridegroom's voice, signifying support and honor in his role. This translation maintains the metaphorical richness of the original text.

fresh_translation.text: The one who has the bride is the bridegroom. The friend who stands by and listens to him is full of joy at the bridegroom's voice. So my joy is complete.

source: ὁ ἔχων τὴν νύμφην νυμφίος ἐστίν· ὁ δὲ φίλος τοῦ νυμφίου, ὁ ἑστηκὼς καὶ ἀκούων αὐτοῦ, χαρᾷ χαίρει διὰ τὴν φωνὴν τοῦ νυμφίου. αὕτη οὖν ἡ χαρὰ ἡ ἐμὴ πεπλήρωται.

related_verses.text: In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
To this John replied, 'A person can receive only what is given them from heaven.'
And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.
I eagerly expect and hope that I will in no way be ashamed, but will have sufficient courage so that now as always Christ will be exalted in my body, whether by life or by death.
Humble yourselves, therefore, under God’s mighty hand, that he may lift you up in due time.

translation_notes: This verse captures the essence of humility and the need for Jesus to grow in prominence while John acknowledges his own decrease. The phrase reflects the idea of prioritizing the divine over personal ambition.

fresh_translation.text: He must become greater, but I must become less.

source: ἐκεῖνον δεῖ αὐξάνειν, ἐμὲ δὲ ἐλαττοῦσθαι.

related_verses.text: But He said to them, "You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world."
I have given them Your word; and the world has hated them because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
The first man was of the earth, made of dust; the second Man is the Lord from heaven.
Set your mind on things above, not on things on the earth.
For our citizenship is in heaven, from which we also eagerly wait for the Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes the distinction between Jesus, who is from above, and those who are from the earth. The focus is on the superiority and authority of Jesus over all things.

fresh_translation.text: The One who comes from above is above all. The one who is from the earth belongs to the earth and speaks as one from the earth; the One who comes from heaven is above all.

source: ὁ ἄνωθεν ἐρχόμενος ἐπάνω πάντων ἐστίν. ὁ ὢν ἐκ τῆς γῆς ἐκ τῆς γῆς ἐστι καὶ ἐκ τῆς γῆς λαλεῖ· ὁ ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ ἐρχόμενος ἐπάνω πάντων ἐστί,

related_verses.text: And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we have seen his glory, glory as of the only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth.
Whoever believes in the Son of God has the testimony in himself. Whoever does not believe God has made him a liar, because he has not believed in the testimony that God has borne concerning his Son.
He was still speaking when, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and a voice from the cloud said, 'This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased; listen to him.'
To him all the prophets bear witness that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.
Who bore witness to the word of God and to the testimony of Jesus Christ, even to all that he saw.

translation_notes: In this verse, the focus is on the act of witnessing and the rejection of that witness by others. It emphasizes the contrast between what is seen and heard by Jesus and the lack of acceptance from the people. The phrase 'no one receives his testimony' indicates a broader theme of disbelief that runs throughout the Gospel of John.

fresh_translation.text: He testifies to what he has seen and heard, yet no one accepts his testimony.

source: καὶ ὃ ἑώρακε καὶ ἤκουσε, τοῦτο μαρτυρεῖ, καὶ τὴν μαρτυρίαν αὐτοῦ οὐδεὶς λαμβάνει.

related_verses.text: Very truly I tell you, we speak of what we know, and we testify to what we have seen, but still you people do not accept our testimony.

Anyone who believes in the Son of God has this testimony in their heart. Anyone who does not believe God has made him out to be a liar, because they have not believed the testimony God has given about his Son.
If I testify about myself, my testimony is not true.
Jesus answered, "Even if I testify on my own behalf, my testimony is valid, for I know where I came from and where I am going. But you have no idea where I come from or where I am going."
God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold of the hope set before us may be greatly encouraged.

translation_notes: The original Greek text emphasizes the idea that accepting Jesus's testimony confirms the truthfulness of God. This translation captures the essential meaning while maintaining clarity and fidelity to the source text.

fresh_translation.text: Whoever accepts his testimony has confirmed that God is truly truthful.

source: ὁ λαβὼν αὐτοῦ τὴν μαρτυρίαν ἐσφράγισεν ὅτι ὁ Θεὸς ἀληθής ἐστιν.

related_verses.text: Jesus answered them, "My teaching is not mine, but his who sent me."
Behold, my servant whom I have chosen, my beloved with whom my soul is well pleased. I will put my Spirit upon him, and he will proclaim justice to the Gentiles.
We are from God. Whoever knows God listens to us; whoever is not from God does not listen to us. By this we know the Spirit of truth and the spirit of error.

The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim liberty to the captives and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty those who are oppressed.
You, however, are not in the flesh but in the Spirit, if in fact the Spirit of God dwells in you. Anyone who does not have the Spirit of Christ does not belong to him.

translation_notes: This translation captures the original meaning of the Greek text, emphasizing that the one sent by God speaks God's words and that the Spirit is given in full measure without limit.

fresh_translation.text: For the one whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God gives the Spirit without measure.

source: ὃν γὰρ ἀπέστειλεν ὁ Θεός, τὰ ῥήματα τοῦ Θεοῦ λαλεῖ· οὐ γὰρ ἐκ μέτρου δίδωσιν ὁ Θεὸς τὸ Πνεῦμα.

related_verses.text: I and the Father are one.
And a voice from heaven said, "This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased."
He who did not spare his own Son, but gave him up for us all—how will he not also, along with him, graciously give us all things?
For he has rescued us from the dominion of darkness and brought us into the kingdom of the Son he loves,
This is how God showed his love among us: He sent his one and only Son into the world that we might live through him.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes the love of the Father for the Son and the authority given to the Son, highlighting the intimate relationship between them.

fresh_translation.text: The Father loves the Son and has given everything into His hands.

source: ὁ πατὴρ ἀγαπᾷ τὸν υἱὸν καὶ πάντα δέδωκεν ἐν τῇ χειρὶ αὐτοῦ.

related_verses.text: Very truly I tell you, whoever hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life and will not be judged but has crossed over from death to life.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
Very truly I tell you, the one who believes has eternal life.
Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.
I told you that you would die in your sins; if you do not believe that I am he, you will indeed die in your sins.

translation_notes: This verse highlights the contrast between belief in Jesus as the Son and the consequence of disbelief. It emphasizes the concept of eternal life as a gift for believers and God's wrath as a consequence for those who do not believe.

fresh_translation.text: Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life; but whoever does not obey the Son will not see life, but the wrath of God remains on them.

source: ὁ πιστεύων εἰς τὸν υἱὸν ἔχει ζωὴν αἰώνιον· ὁ δὲ ἀπειθῶν τῷ υἱῷ οὐκ ὄψεται ζωήν, ἀλλ᾽ ἡ ὀργὴ τοῦ Θεοῦ μένει ἐπ᾽ αὐτόν.
